title: Government had no outstanding loans from RBI in March 9 week
text: March 16, 2018 / 11:37 AM / Updated 8 hours ago Government had no outstanding loans from RBI in March 9 week Reuters Staff 1 Min Read (Reuters) - The government had no outstanding loans with the central bank under ways and means FILE PHOTO - An India rupee note is seen in this illustration photo June 1, 2017. REUTERS/Thomas White/Illustration/File Photo advances in the week ended March 9, according to the Reserve Bank of Indiaâ€™s weekly statistical supplement released on Friday. The central government had no outstanding loans in the week earlier as well. State governments had 60.63 billion rupees ($933.2 million) loans from the RBI in the week ended March 9, compared with 2.16 billion rupees in the previous week, the release showed.
